episode_title: 223 - The One With the Chicken Pox
note: [Scene: Central Perk. Rachel, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are there.]

content.text: [Rachel brings a muffin to Chandler and Monica who are sitting on the couch.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Chandler, Mon, there’s only one bananna nut muffin left.
[Rachel holds the tray between them. Chandler grabs the muffin before Monica can.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I ordered mine first.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, but I’m, I’m so much faster…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give it to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give it to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, you can have it. [He licks it and offers it to her.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [She grabs the coffee cup on the table and licks the rim.] There you go, enjoy your coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was there when I got here. [Takes a bite of his muffin.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [enters] Hey you guys, you will never guess who’s coming to New York.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [Chandler tries to come back with a smart-ass remark but can’t swallow the muffin.] Quick, Phoebe, tell us before he can swallow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh ok, Ryan, that guy I went out with, who’s in the Navy.
[Chandler is visibly upset]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You went out with a guy in the Navy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I met him when I was playing guitar in Washington Square Park. Ryan threw in salt water taffy ’cause he didn’t have any change.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, is that when you wrote salt water taffy man?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. No, he is my submaring guy. He resurfaces like every couple years and we have the most amazing three days together. Only this time he’s coming for two weeks. Two whole weeks, which means yay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So wait, this guy goes down for like two years at a time?
[Once again, Chandler has a bite in his mouth and can’t come back.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’ll teach you to lick my muffin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [enters] Hiii.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, what happened?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I just spoke to Carol. Ben’s got the chicken pox.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, so if you haven’t already had it, chances are you’re gonna get it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I’ve had it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I’ve had it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Had it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Had it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’ve never had it, I feel so left out. [Sees a red bump on her arm.] Oh look!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Richard are in her bedroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, you made the bed again. I told you, you don’t have to do that. This isn’t camp.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ooh, then I guess the panty raid last night was totally uncalled for. Ok, I am going to take a shower and today I will be singing Jim Crochee’s Leroy Brown.
[He walks out of the bedroom and Monica starts to remake the bed.]

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Monica… [He re-enters the bedroom and Monica jumps on the bed, trying to cover it.] Hey Mon, I have a question. Is Leroy the baddest man in the whole damn town or the fattest man in the whole damn town?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Baddest. Otherwise the song would be Fat Fat Leroy Brown.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What’re you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just waiting for you sweetie.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Are you remaking the bed?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m sorry. You know what, the way you did it was just fine.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Then, you’re redoing it because…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If I tell you, you’ll think I’m crazy.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You’re pretty much running that risk either way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, you see, the tag shouldn’t be at the top left corner, it should be at the bottom right corner.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, well that’s not so crazy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m just easing you in.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, alright.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, you see these little flower blossoms? They should be facing up, not down, because, well, the head of the bed is where the sun would be. You don’t love me any more do you.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Actually, if it’s possible, I love you more.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Wow, well then come on, I wanna show you how to fold the toilet paper into a point.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look Joey, I’m just saying if you need something to hold you over, I can get you a job right here as an entry level processor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But don’t you need experience for a job like that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not that hard to learn. And as for people realizing you have no idea what you’re doing, hey, you’re an actor. Act like a processor, people will think you’re a processor.

content.speaker: Scott
content.text: [enters] Hey Chandler, here’s this morning’s projections.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey thanks. Scott Alexander, Joey Tribbianni. Joey is a uh, fellow processor.

content.speaker: Scott
content.text: No kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah yeah. I process. People want the processing, I’m the one they call.

content.speaker: Scott
content.text: Where do you work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, well, right now I’m in between things. You know how it is. One day you’re processing, the next day you’re not so much… processing any more.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was just telling Joey about the opening in Fleischman’s group.

content.speaker: Scott
content.text: Fleischman’s group. Whatever you do, don’t touch his sandwiches. Ha-ha-ha…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ha-ha. [Scott leaves] Are all you processors dorks?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Rachel are doing Phoebe’s makeup.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, this lipstick looks just great on you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You look fabulous honey, you really do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? Are you sure, really. [She picks up a mirror and sees the white splotches all over her face.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You see, you look beautiful. For god sakes, dim the lights.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, I, I’m hideous.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s gonna be ok. Ryan’s been under water. He’s just gonna be so glad that you don’t have barnicles on your butt.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Ryan is walks up to the door and knocks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come in.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Hey baby, I’m back… [Phoebe is sitting by the window in a veil.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Ryan, what’s up?

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, no no, you have to stay back. I, I have the pox.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Chicken or small?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chicken. Which is so ironic considering I’m a vegetarian.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Why aren’t you at home in bed?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’Cause my, my grandmother’s never had chicken pox. Please, please tell me you have, ’cause oh my God, I forgot how cute you are.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: I’m sorry, I never had ’em.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, ohh.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: If I had one wish, it would be to build a time machine, go back to when I was 7, when Jimmy Hauser had the chicken pox. I would grab that kid and rub him all over my face.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, or you know, you could just wish that I didn’t have them now.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Can I please see your face?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nope. You don’t want to see a face covered with pox.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Your face could be covered with lochs, I wouldn’t care.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And you hate fish. Oh. That’s so sweet, alright. Ok, alright, you can see. This is me… [she unveils herself right as a huge lightning bolt crashes outside. Ryan screams in terror.] Oh, I am scary.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Sorry, the lightning. Lightning was an unfortunate incidence. You look lovely, lovely.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I hate this. ’Cause I tell you, I had the most amazing two weeks planned for us, and almost everything I had in mind, we had to be a lot closer than this.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Phoebe, I have spent the last eight months in a steel tube with men, thinking about this moment. I am not gonna let a bunch of itchy spots stand between us. [He walks to her and kisses her.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, this is the most romantic disease I’ve ever had.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, how’s the first day goin’?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty good. It’s like you said. It’s mostly just putting numbers from one column into another column.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well there you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey and everbody is so nice. I just had a good talk with that lady with the red hair, Jeannie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jeannie, the head of east coast operations Jeannie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, turns out our kids go to the same school. Small world huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Weird world. Your kids?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I figure my character has kids.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know there isn’t a part of that sentence I don’t need explained.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, see when you’re acting you need to think about stuff like that. My character, Joseph the processor guy, has two little girls, Ashley and Brittany. Ashley copies everything Brittany does.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, invisible kids can be that way sometimes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Joseph and his wife, Karen, are thinking of having a third kid… Ya know what? Just did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Wow. That’s some pretty powerful imaginary sperm you must have there.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Phoebe and Ryan are playing Monopoly.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: You know what makes the itching even worse?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That you don’t stop talking about it.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s just play, ok. Good, ok. [She picks up the dice.] Here we go, double sixes, here we go… [She starts to rub the dice all over herself.] Here we go, come to mama, just getting ready to roll the dice…

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: What’re you doing? Are you scratching?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. This is what I do for luck, ok.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: You’re scratching. Give me the dice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Give me the dice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. Here. [Throws them on the table.] There. Ooh, double sixes.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: We can’t scratch. You know we can’t, we’ll scar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uhh, I can’t stop thinking about it. It’s just so hard. I just wanna grab all these houses and rub ’em all over my body. [Grabs a handful of the houses.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Give it.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, come on. You know you want it, you know you want it too, come on. Let’s just be bad, it’ll feel so good. [She starts scratching him.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Oh God help me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now do me, do my back. Oh come on, harder.
[They get back to back and start rubbing against each other. Ross and Rachel enter.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, stop that, stop that right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, I might have expected this of you Phoebe, but Ryan, you’re a military man.

content.description: Chandler’s office building. Joey and Jeannie are talking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You and Milton have to join us on the boat. Karen’ll pack a lunch, you’ll bring the kids, we’ll make a day of it.

content.speaker: Jeannie
content.text: Oh, that sounds lovely. We’re gonna have to set that up. Oh, I better get back. Hope the baby feels better.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, thanks, thanks. Bye bye Jeannie.

content.speaker: Jeannie
content.text: Bye bye Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What a phony.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m sure you’ll teach her a lesson when she steps off the dock onto nothing. Hey Mr. Douglas.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sir.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Uh, listen Bing, I received your memo. So, we’re not gonna receive the systems report until next Friday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well the people in my group wanna spend the holiday weekend with their families.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: I have a family, I’m gonna be here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah Bing, what’s that about?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s about cutting my people a little slack, ya know, for morale. Look, if you wanna see some rough numbers, I can get them to you by Wednesday.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Rough numbers?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This company was not built on rough numbers. Am I right Mr. Douglas.

content.speaker: Mr. Douglas
content.text: Have the final numbers on my desk by Tuesday.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, if you say so sir.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joseph’s good, isn’t he?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m going to kill you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, I just figure Joseph’s the kinda guy that likes to mix it up. Ya know, get in there, ruffle some feathers.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I’m sorry but that’s what Joseph does, ok. If you try to pull somethin’, he’ll call you on it. ‘What’re you tryin’ to pull,’ he’ll say.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica enters her bedroom with a roll of duct tape. Richard is sitting on the bed.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ooh, duct tape. Was I supposed to bring something too?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is for the scratchy twins out there. I taped oven mits to their hands.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You’re strict.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s for their own good.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You know, I like the way you have efficiently folded this tab under. See in a tape emergency you could shave valuable seconds off your time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Exactly. Oh, I love that I can be totally neurotic around you now. Tell me the truth. Don’t you like it better now that everything on your desk is perpendicular?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: If it’s not a right angle, it is a wrong angle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Very good.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what. Tomorrow I’m gonna do your clocks.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You’re gonna do what to my clocks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna set them to my time.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, I’m confused. I thought we shared time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No no. See, in my bedroom I set my clock six minutes fast. You wanna know why?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Because it’s in a slightly different time zone than the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No forget it, I’m not gonna tell you now.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No come on. Come on tell me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. See you don’t understand.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. You don’t have any of these cute little obsessive things.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No that’s not true. That is not true.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, well tell me one of yours.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ok. Ahh. One of my things is, I always separate my sweat socks from my dress socks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if they get mixed up?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Boy I would just uh, I would freak out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You would not. I can’t believe this. I hate this, you’re too normal. I can’t believe my boyfriend doesn’t have a thing. My boyfriend doesn’t have a thing.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: See, if anyone overheard that, I didn’t come off well.

content.description: Chandler’s office. Chandler is asleep in his chair holding a paper in one hand and a pen in the other. Joey walks in, waking up Chandler who covers by pretending to write on the paper.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. Mr. Douglas is looking for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why? Wh- wh- why is Mr. Douglas looking for me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ’Cause he has a strong suspicion that you dropped the ball on the Lender project.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wha- wh- why, why, why does he suspect that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Becasue at first he thought it was Joseph. But after he asked Joseph about it, turns out it was you. Anyway, I just thought you should know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, that’s it. Look Joey, I’m sorry, I realize this is the role of a lifetime for ya, and if I could just fire Joseph, I would, but unfortunately that’s not possible so I’m gonna have to let both of you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’re you talking about, everybody loves Joseph.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t, I hate Joseph, ok. I think he’s a brown-nosing suck up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah. Well you can’t fire Joseph. You know why, ’cause he’s not in your department.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, ok, alright. So I can’t fire Joseph but uh, I can sleep with his wife.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Karen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Karen. I’m thinking about having an affair with her. Oh, you know what? I just did.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh. What the hell are you doing to me man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well it’s not me, it’s my character, Chandy. Yeah the rogue processor who seduces his co-worker’s wives for sport and then laughs about it the next day at the water cooler. In fact, I have her panties right there in my drawer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No freakshow, she’s fictional.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Take it easy. If it means that much to you, I’ll uh, I’ll go find something else.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s just that, I, I’m gonna miss Joseph. I liked him. His wife, she was hot. [Chadler pushes him out the door by the face.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Rachel and Ross are in the kitchen. Phoebe is sitting at the couch with oven mits on her hands.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can I please take these off? I swear I won’t scratch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No sorry hon, Monica’s orders.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: [Comes out of the bathroom, also with oven mits on his hands.] Well that wasn’t easy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, dinner’s on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And there’s a peach cobbler warming in the oven so the plate’s gonna be hot but that shouldn’t be a problem for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright you kids, bye now.

content.speaker: Phoebe & Ryan
content.text: Bye. [waving]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh look, a low budget puppet show.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s such a shame you can’t see which finger I’m holding up.
[Ross and Rachel leave.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Wine?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please. [Ryan pulls the cork with his teeth and spits it into Phoebe’s mits.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Oh, I spilled some.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got it. [Wipes it up with her mits.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: [Puts his hands over Phoebe’s ears.] I must tell you, you look beautiful tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Sorry. You look beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.
[They start to kiss. They try to get each other’s shirts off but can’t get the buttons undone.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know what, that’s it, that’s it. [She rips off the mits, Ryan follows her lead.]
[They keep kissing and start scratching each other. Ross enters, takes one look, and goes right back out the door.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Richard and Monica are in bed.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Monica, wake up. Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I thought of a thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah. I have to sleep, have to, on this side of the bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No honey. You have to sleep on this side of the bed because I have to sleep on this side of the bed.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Or so I would have you believe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. Big deal, so you have a side of the bed, everybody has a side of the bed.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey come on, you haven’t heard my reason yet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, go on.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ok, I have to sleep on the west side because I grew up in California and otherwise the ocean would be on the wrong side.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, you’re a freak.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah. How ‘bout that.

content.description: Central Perk. Phoebe, Rachel, Ross, and Ryan are there. Ryan is in uniform, getting ready to leave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So uh, Ryan, were you shipping off to?

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: I really can’t say.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So do you have like any nuclear weapons on board?

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: I can’t say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well do you get to look through one of those like, those periscope thingys.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: I’m sorry, but I can’t say.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, it, it’s neat learning about submarines.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: I better get out of here, I’m gonna miss my flight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, I’ll walk you out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye Ryan.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Pleasure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was nice to meet you.

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Take care.
[Phoebe and Ryan walk outside.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So do you uh, think we can get you one of those uh, uniform things?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You like that do ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll make some calls. [Runs off.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.
[Outside with Phoebe and Ryan.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Can you believe how we spent our two weeks together?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. We didn’t do any of the romantic things I had planned, like having a picnic at Central Park and ya know, coffee at Central Perk. Oh I just got that. [They kiss.]

content.speaker: Ryan
content.text: Taxi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye you. [Ryan’s cab drives off. As Phoebe is going back in, she sees the Central Perk sign in the window and laughs.]

content.description: Central Perk. Rachel is closing. Ross walks in in a uniform.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I’m sorry, we’re clo-… Hey sailor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is this what you had in mind?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll say.
[Ross picks her up.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m shipping out tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then uh, we better make this night count. [He starts to carry her out.] Oh wait, I forgot to turn off the cappucino machine. [He carries her over to turn it off.] Anchors away. Oh no no, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my pu rse. [He carries her to the counter to pick up her purse.] Oh, you know what. I forgot to turn off the bathroom light.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright you know, why don’t I just meet you upstairs. [Drops her on the couch and walks out holding his lower back.]
